titleInfo.title: USA v. Simones
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - AMENDED ON 9/6/2005 PER ORDER 20 The motion of counsel for defendant to withdraw, filing 12 is denied. The amended motion of counsel for defendant to withdraw, filing 13 is granted effective upon the filing of a certificate of service or affidavit indicating that the defendant has been served with a copy of this order. Defendant is given 20 days from the date of this order in which to either: (1) obtain the services of substitute counsel and have that attorney file an appearance in his behalf or, (2) file a financial affidavit setting forth his present financial status, requesting the appointment of counsel. The time between August 25, 2005 and September 15, 2005 shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act, for the reason that the defendant does not have an attorney. 18 U.S.C. sec. 3161(h)(8)(A)&(B). Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 8/25/2005. (GJG, ) Modified on 9/6/2005 to indicate that the order was amended per order 20 (GJG, ).

Defendant is given 20 days from the date of this order in which to either: (1) obtain the services of substitute counsel and have that attorney file an appearance in his behalf or, (2) file a financial affidavit setting forth his present financial status, requesting the appointment of counsel. The time between August 25, 2005 and September 15, 2005 shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act, for the reason that the defendant does not have an attorney. 18 U.S.C. sec. 3161(h)(8)(A)&(B). Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 8/25/2005. (GJG, ) Modified on 9/6/2005 to indicate that the order was amended per order 20 (GJG, ).

titleInfo.title: USA v. Simones
titleInfo.subTitle: Order re: "reasonable doubt" standard at sentencing, and the clerk shall file this Memorandum and Order in all pending criminal cases. Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 8/31/2005. (KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: Order re: "reasonable doubt" standard at sentencing, and the clerk shall file this Memorandum and Order in all pending criminal cases. Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 8/31/2005. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Simones
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - IT THEREFORE HEREBY IS ORDERED, Paragraphs 2-4 of the order of August 25, 2005, filing 14 are reinstated with the following amendments: a. The defendant is given twenty days from today's date to obtain substitute counsel or request appointment of counsel. b. The time between August 25, 2005 and September 30, 2005 shall be excluded from calculation of time under the Speedy Trial Act, 18 U.S.C. 3161(h), for the reason that the defendant's interest in having counsel outweighs the interests of the public and the defendant in a speedy trial and therefore, the failure to exclude this time would result in a miscarriage of justice as to Robert A. Simones (1). Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 9/6/2005. (GJG, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Simones
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 21 Motion to Continue as to Robert A. Simones (1). The defendant's trial shall be continued until December 12, 2005, at 9:00 a.m. The defendant is ordered to appear at said time. The time from September 28, 2005, until December 12, 2005, shall be excludable time pursuant to 18 U.S.C. section 3161(h)(8)(A). Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 9/28/2005. (GJG, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Simones
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Revised Presentence Investigation Report and Addendum as to defendant Robert A. Simones. It is ordered that: (1) The defendant's objection to criminal history 36 will be resolved at sentencing.(2) Except to the extent (if at all) that I have reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects.ETC. Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 5/11/2006. (KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Revised Presentence Investigation Report and Addendum as to defendant Robert A. Simones. It is ordered that: (1) The defendant's objection to criminal history 36 will be resolved at sentencing.(2) Except to the extent (if at all) that I have reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects.ETC. Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 5/11/2006. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Simones
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Robert A. Simones (1). Defendant pleaded guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of twenty-four (24) months; three (3) years of Supervised Release with Special Conditions; $100 Special Assesment. It is recommended that the Bureau of Prisons give the defendant credit for time served from June 6, 2005 through July 6, 2005. Count 2, Dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this Defendant only as to defendant(s) Robert A. Simones. Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 5/24/2006. 4 CERTIFIED COPIES TO USM. (GJG, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Simones
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT (For Revocation of Probation or Supervised Release) as to defendant Robert A. Simones (1). Defendant admitted guilt to violation of special conditions 2 and 4 of the term of supervision and is committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons for a term of twenty-four (24) months with no supervised release to follow. $100 special assessment is paid. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (1 Certified copy to USM) (JAB)
